holidays.name: Talk Like a Pirate Day 🏴‍☠️
holidays.description: An amusing day where everyone is encouraged to talk and dress like a pirate, embracing pirate lingo and spirit for fun.
holidays.origin: Created in 1995 by John Baur and Mark Summers, two friends from Oregon, who decided to dedicate a day to pirate speak after a playful argument about pirates.
holidays.funFact: The founders decided on September 19th because it was Summers' ex-wife’s birthday, making it easier to remember!

holidays.name: International Chocolate Day 🍫
holidays.description: A celebration of one of the world’s favorite sweet treats: chocolate! A perfect excuse to indulge in all things cocoa.
holidays.origin: While there's no single official origin, the day is recognized internationally and coincides with the birthday of Milton S. Hershey, founder of the Hershey Chocolate Company.
holidays.funFact: Chocolate was once used as currency by the Aztecs — so on this day, technically you’re making it 'raining money' when you eat chocolate!

holidays.name: National Butterscotch Pudding Day 🍮
holidays.description: A yummy day dedicated to the creamy, sweet, buttery dessert that brings back nostalgic flavors from childhood.
holidays.origin: This day emerged from food enthusiasts who love carving out days to celebrate specific classic desserts.
holidays.funFact: Butterscotch pudding contains real butter and brown sugar, but despite its name, the dessert isn’t actually made with scotch whisky!

holidays.name: Respect for the Aged Day (Japan) 👵👴
holidays.description: A day in Japan dedicated to honoring and respecting elderly citizens, celebrating their wisdom and contributions.
holidays.origin: Became a national holiday in Japan in 1966, held on the third Monday in September (sometimes September 19).
holidays.funFact: Communities in Japan often host events and give gifts to the elderly on this day, highlighting their revered place in society.
